title: Bibliographic Reference
description: A bibliographic Reference. Note: The `type` field in a reference refers to the type of reference, not the type of DLx object.

firstName.title: First Name
firstName.description: The first name(s) of this author

lastName.title: Last Name
lastName.description: The last name(s) of this author

id.title: ID
id.description: A unique database identifier for this Reference

authors.title: Authors
authors.description: An array of authors for this Reference

items.title: Author
items.description: A Person object representing an author

city.title: City
city.description: The city in which this reference was published

doi.title: Digital Object Identifier (DOI)
doi.description: The Digtial Object Identifier (DOI) for this publication. This should be just the DOI itself, not a URL (e.g. `10.1075/cal.20.02hie` not `https://doi.org/10.1075/cal.20.02hie`).

edition.title: Edition
edition.description: The edition of this Reference, formatted as an integer

editors.title: Editors
editors.description: An array of editors for this Reference

firstName.title: First Name
firstName.description: The first name(s) of this editor

lastName.title: Last Name
lastName.description: The last name(s) of this editor

pages.title: Pages
pages.description: The page numbers of this Reference

publication.title: Publication
publication.description: The publication where this item was published

publisher.title: Publisher (or Institution)
publisher.description: The name of the publisher of this reference, or the institution where it was published

series.title: Series
series.description: The series in which this publication was published

translators.title: Translators
translators.description: An array of translators for this Reference

items.title: Translator (Person)
items.description: A Person object representing a translator

volume.title: Volume
volume.description: The volume number for this publication

year.title: Year
year.description: The year this item was published. Use a positive integer for AD / ACE, and a negative integer for BC / BCE.
